page.title: 12INFORMATION ON POLICE
page.content: The Police Station has 16 patrol cars. The garage is out the back. The Bucksburn Station is computerised. They have a computer for the registration numbers of all the cars in Britian. The computer will tell if the car is stolen or involved in a crime.There is a computer for the public who may phone in asking, for example, for the address of vets, information about the oil rigs, and it can also tell you where a street or a shop is in Aberdeen. There is another computer for breathalising people; you blow into it and it gives an alcohol reading. Ifthe reading is over 35 you have had too much to drink and you are charged.
